TopicTitle: "The Wrath of Mortimer Kerman" a graphic novel by my kid!

Articles.Content:
My son is still too young to have his own forum account, but he is old enough to take screenshots, and use powerpoint. He asked me to post this for him--so, here's his entry into the world of KSP webcomics!

Yes, my kid really did this. You can tell it's not my game, because of all the part mods

Edited September 24, 2015 by Kuzzter
It's a good start.
Wow! This is really good, and it actually made me laugh out loud.

@Kuzzter, he can always put a fake birthdate, lol. Seriously though, it's less about age and more about maturity, so, if you think he is mature enough to join, then okay. However, you're his dad, so, who am I to argue with you about it.

Anyways, I'd say that's a nice start to the comic.

Seriously though, it's less about age and more about maturity, so, if you think he is mature enough to join, then okay.

Well he read your comment over my shoulder, then started jumping around yelling "I'm mature! I'm mature!" until he crashed into a doorway. I think maybe we'll wait a bit

And yeah, I think it is a pretty good start. Of course I like that he took a few cues from my work, and I like even more that he went his own direction in a lot of ways.

Well he read your comment over my shoulder, then started jumping around yelling "I'm mature! I'm mature!" until he crashed into a doorway. I think maybe we'll wait a bit

And yeah, I think it is a pretty good start. Of course I like that he took a few cues from my work, and I like even more that he went his own direction in a lot of ways.

LOL! *facepalm* XD
i started playing ksp 'seriously' when i was 11
Again, think of Edd. He got web-famous after he made tons of web-comics he started making when heÃ¢â‚¬â€¹ was 11.
Give him some rep from me . . . wait...

Well he read your comment over my shoulder, then started jumping around yelling "I'm mature! I'm mature!" until he crashed into a doorway. I think maybe we'll wait a bit

And yeah, I think it is a pretty good start. Of course I like that he took a few cues from my work, and I like even more that he went his own direction in a lot of ways.

I'm also rather young, though not as young as him, and it seems we've learned a few from you in general. In any case, I'm excited to see more!

Wow, this is better than E:O0.

...

I'M JUST KIDDING, JUST KIDDING, SORRY, NO NEED TO KILL ME

Give him some rep from me . . . wait...

Forum: "You must wait for Kuzzter's kid to grow up before you can give him reputation."

Wow, this is better than E:O0.

Well for one thing, none of those goofball interludes!

The only thing the forum rules about age says this:

4.4 Users under the age of 18

Users under the age of 18 who reveal their age and/or face on official KSP community channels, may have their messages/photos removed for privacy purposes.

There's a law in the US the prohits kids under the age of 13 from doing anything on the Internet. It's stupid because kids are going to lie about their age, or we're are going to need to use a credit card for all the websites. IMHO if the parent allows it go ahead. Also, ask him if he wants you to proofread his grammer, but quite honestly the graphics were very well put together. Probably better than what I could do considering I don't have Powerpoint

Forum: "You must wait for Kuzzter's kid to grow up before you can give him reputation."

Well for one thing, none of those goofball interludes!

It has gotten to the point where I just start spamming the rep button on every post you write now. I want that stupid "Spread the rep around" message to go away so badly!

Also, ask him if he wants you to proofread his grammer, but quite honestly the graphics were very well put together.

He's got a good eye, yes! I think his grammar isn't so bad, but the spelling...well, like a lot of kids he just rights watt he heres.

It has gotten to the point where I just start spamming the rep button on every post you write now. I want that stupid "Spread the rep around" message to go away so badly!

Your continued amusement is all the reward I need.
Poor Mort. Everyone's bashing on him now Even kids think he's too cheap to pay measly couple hundreds of roots for the fuel needed for a intercontinental flight.
Reminds me, I'm not too much older than he is...

Good start! How did he got the powerpoint skills?

Those part mods tho...

Is he reading these comments?

Is he reading these comments?

Yes he is. Keep it clean you lot!

I know he is just a kid. But my sense of fanfic tells me that the kid has a deep wish to tell us a tale aboult his kerbals.

So... let him post!

And kudos!
Hey, Kuzzter's son, tell your dad that he should make more chapters and begone with these interludes!

I know he is just a kid. But my sense of fanfic tells me that the kid has a deep wish to tell us a tale aboult his kerbals.

So... let him post!

Well, he does have a birthday coming up... we'll see. If nothing else I'll keep posting for him. Any rep you give for the comics themselves (and not my ever-so-witty comments) I'll set aside for him until he comes of age. Sort of like a fake internet points trust fund!

Hey, Kuzzter's son, tell your dad that he should make more chapters and begone with these interludes!

Boo hoo! Just for that you're getting an extended dream sequence of Lord Admiral Kenlie's Grand Tour of Non-Existent Planets! Also starring Gregmore and Marker Guy, with MANY special appearances by Languages I Write Even Worse Than English!

Hey Kuzzter's son, congratulations on your webcomic!

I like it a lot and hope to see much more.

You should pick a nickname so that we can call you something other than Kuzzter's son.

Happy landings!
Looks like the artistic impulses run in the family. Hope your son keeps up the good work!
